title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:22 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:22 <mflorea> has quit  
00:28 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: You didn't assign yourself to XWIKI-4495  
00:31 <cjdelisle> Ok then I will.  
00:32 <cjdelisle> IIRC I have assigned myself to dupelicates and had someone unassign me so I assumed assignment was only acceptable if work had been done to fix it.  
00:34 <@sdumitriu> Investigation is still work, you looked at it and decided its status  
00:44 <@sdumitriu> But the rule is that the person that closes the issue assigns himself to it  
00:44 <cjdelisle> A rule, I can follow.  
00:44 <@sdumitriu> No closed issue should ever be without an assignee  
00:45 <cjdelisle> I will remember that.  
00:46 <esdaniel> has quit  
01:35 <abusenius> has quit  
03:46 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
03:47 <venkatesh> has quit  
03:49 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
04:23 <DrLou> has quit  
05:01 <Pon> woo! its snowing in tokyo! But not settling  
05:02 <cjdelisle> cool. we have ~3 feet here. How's the site running?  
05:02 <@sdumitriu> 3 feet?  
05:02 <Pon> seems fine, feel free to poke it.  
05:02 <@sdumitriu> Didn't see that much in a long time  
05:02 <Pon> tokyo goes all a-panic if it settles  
05:03 <cjdelisle> well give or take... 4 foot where the snowblower puts it.  
05:03 <Pon> The most snow I have seen in oh, nearly twenty years, we had about 20cm one winter,  
05:03 <Pon> 1998? 97?  
05:04 <cjdelisle> Around here they use a road grader to plough.  
05:05 <Pon> java process seems stable ticking over at 1.6G and 352 threads!  
05:05 <cjdelisle> yea java memory is annoying  
05:05 <Pon> http://tenki.jp/forecast/point-695.html   <-- the weather  
05:06 <Pon> amazingly enough, they were right when they said on monday/tuesday "snow on friday"  
05:07 <cjdelisle> "feel free to poke it." hehe that's probably not a good idea.  
05:08 <cjdelisle> hear about this one? 2.2250738585072012e-308  
05:09 <Pon> the floating point numbers killer thing?  
05:09 <Pon> I think that is hillarious  
05:09 <cjdelisle> float was a horrible idea to start with and noone uses it anyway.  
05:10 <Pon> o. google logo is "edison's birthday" today.  
05:18 <Pon> I think we should use only integers! henceforth, ?=3  
05:19 <Pon> Except on sundays, when ?=4  
05:19 <cjdelisle> anything with $$ always uses BigDecimal because float has weird rounding errors.  
05:20 <@sdumitriu> Actually floating point numbers are pretty neat  
05:20 <Pon> ieee ^^;  
05:20 <@sdumitriu> Infinite precision can't be stored in binary  
05:24 <Pon> under what circumstances is infinite precision a requirement?  
05:24 <@sdumitriu> Found a bug with CSRF tokens...  
05:24 <@sdumitriu> They can generate \_\_ which means underline  
05:25 <@sdumitriu> Which breaks the HTML when the content is supposed to allow wiki syntax  
07:06 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <vmassol> has quit  
08:02 <jbrBridge> has quit  
08:04 <jbrBridge> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <jstoldt> good morning  
08:12 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
08:37 <jstoldt> small question, i am including a Space1.Page1 in Space2.Page2 with Page1 pointing to an attachment of the document Page1. Now, when I try to click the link in the included bit in Page2 the download link is all wrong  
08:37 <jstoldt> i can, of course, make the link point to the proper page and space (i.e. [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)) but i was hoping for a more generic way  
08:38 <jstoldt> is there such a way?  
08:39 <@cjdelisle> {{include document="Sp1.Page1" context=new /}}  
08:39 <@cjdelisle> give that a shot  
08:39 <jstoldt> i tried that, at least in the preview the link remains faulty  
08:39 <jstoldt> but i'll try saving...  
08:40 <jstoldt> nope, not working  
08:40 <@cjdelisle> You could report a bug.  
08:41 <jstoldt> sure, will do  
08:41 <jstoldt> thx  
08:41 <@cjdelisle> I am surprised context.new doesn't do it.  
08:42 <@cjdelisle> Can you open the source code and find that link for me?  
08:42 <@cjdelisle> oh actually that won't be helpful.  
08:43 <jstoldt> do you mean the source of the page or the source of the include macro?  
08:43 <@cjdelisle> I was thinking multi wiki not multi space.  
08:43 <jstoldt> ah  
08:43 <@cjdelisle> in which case a reletive link AKA: /bin/view/... would be a killer.  
08:44 <jstoldt> well, if i put the link on Page1 as [[Link>>[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]] i get it working on both pages but like i said, this is not very generic  
08:44 <jstoldt> and i do actually think it works without this trick for images  
08:52 <jstoldt> ah, okay, so apparently the attachments are never available  
08:52 <jstoldt> creating issue  
08:52 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <kwoot> goodmorning.  
08:53 <jstoldt> hi :)  
08:53 <kwoot> can someone tell me in which db table I can find the user information like realname and password?  
08:54 <kwoot> I made a mysqldump but the thing authenticates with ldap so only the admin user is hidden somewheren in this db dump.  
08:56 <@cjdelisle> hehe  
08:56 <@cjdelisle> I doubt you want to try reading the db dump by hand.  
08:56 <@cjdelisle> But the query would look something like:  
08:59 <@cjdelisle> select passwd.value from xwikidoc as doc, xwikiobjects as obj, xwikistrings as passwd where doc.xwd\_name = 'SomeUser' and obj.xwo\_doc\_id = doc.xwd\_id and str.xws.id = obj.xwo\_id;  
08:59 <Pon> cor blimey!  
09:00 <@cjdelisle> (dynamic schema)  
09:01 <kwoot> ERROR 1054 (42S22): Unknown column 'passwd.value' in 'field list'  
09:01 <kwoot> sorry.  
09:01 <@cjdelisle> select passwd.xws\_value from xwikidoc as doc, xwikiobjects as obj, xwikistrings as passwd where doc.xwd\_name = 'SomeUser' and obj.xwo\_doc\_id = doc.xwd\_id and str.xws\_id = obj.xwo\_id and obj.xwo\_classname = 'XWiki.XWikiUsers' and str.xws\_name = 'password';  
09:01 <@cjdelisle> that's more like it.  
09:02 <kwoot> ERROR 1054 (42S22): Unknown column 'obj.xwo\_doc\_id' in 'where clause'  
09:02 <kwoot> Sorry. I know its early....  
09:02 <@cjdelisle> (I'm doing this off the top of my head)  
09:02 <kwoot> wow, Now I am seriously impressed.  
09:02 <kwoot> really  
09:03 <@cjdelisle> oh  
09:03 <jstoldt> XWIKI-5997  
09:03 <jstoldt> hope i got the meta data right ;)  
09:03 <@cjdelisle> select passwd.xws\_value from xwikidoc as doc, xwikiobjects as obj, xwikistrings as passwd where doc.xwd\_name = 'SomeUser' and obj.xwo\_name = doc.xwd\_fullname and str.xws\_id = obj.xwo\_id and obj.xwo\_classname = 'XWiki.XWikiUsers' and str.xws\_name = 'password';  
09:03 <@cjdelisle> that should be it.  
09:03 <@cjdelisle> I was writing for the schema I would like, not the schema we have ;)  
09:04 <Pon> thats quite an evil way to use the database  
09:04 <@cjdelisle> indeed it is.  
09:04 <kwoot> ERROR 1054 (42S22): Unknown column 'str.xws\_id' in 'where clause'  
09:04 <kwoot> trying on my end as well though.  
09:05 <@cjdelisle> We have a method for dynamically generating database schema but it makes no sense for cases where there are only a few objects.  
09:05 <@cjdelisle> (we should port over the user object though)  
09:05 <@cjdelisle> !search dynamic custom mapping  
09:06 <@cjdelisle> hmm there's something in drafts.  
09:06 <Pon> yes, users probably need to be in their own table, because that way of using the db, while elegant, is evil.  
09:07 <Pon> theres probably a PERVERSE ABNORMAL FORM for table usage like that.  
09:07 <kwoot> select str.xws\_value from xwikidoc as doc, xwikiobjects as obj, xwikistrings as str where doc.xwd\_name = 'Admin' and obj.xwo\_name = doc.xwd\_fullname and str.xws\_id = obj.xwo\_id and obj.xwo\_classname = 'XWiki.XWikiUsers' and str.xws\_name = 'password'; +-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | xws\_value  
09:07 <@cjdelisle> heh  
09:07 <@cjdelisle> ok I mixed up 'passwd' and 'str'  
09:08 <kwoot> As you see, no problem :-)  
09:08 <@cjdelisle> just switch all places where it says 'str' to 'passwd'  
09:08 <kwoot> The thing is, I really need to change the loginname of some user. I guess it is all related so there is probably only 1 field I need to change.  
09:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <Pon> I thought you said they were all ldappy  
09:09 <kwoot> yes and no :-)  
09:10 <vmassol> good morning! preparing a blog post with #bugfixingday results  
09:10 <Pon> how many did you fix?  
09:10 <jstoldt> hmmm i changed the loginname of some users once and turned out it was more of a hassel than i thought  
09:10 <vmassol> Pon: you'll see, I'll give the link here  
09:10 <kwoot> I am migrating from a small POC project to a larger ldap based version. the poc project has all users locally, the new envirnoment aithenticated to AD (I know).  
09:10 <Pon> ????  
09:10 <jstoldt> because apparently all rights assigned to the particular users were lost when renaming via the UI  
09:10 <@cjdelisle> haha change the login name of a user. Not with sql you won't.  
09:11 <kwoot> Since all usernames in the POC are the same usernames (except for 1 user) than in the new production server (with ad) I guess migration is simple.  
09:12 <@cjdelisle> I would delete the usernames and have people register.  
09:12 <kwoot> @cjdelisle: your laughing  tells me I'm in trouble :-)  
09:13 <kwoot> so deleting all accounts on the server. people login again, xwiki thinks they are first users and because they have the same loginname they do not loose their history of pages already made?  
09:15 <kwoot> would that work?  
09:15 <@cjdelisle> No, more like people register new usernames and their history starts over.  
09:15 <kwoot> well, since we don't use rights management and everyone can change everything there is no real problem, right?  
09:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <+sburjan> good morning  
09:16 <@cjdelisle> A while back someone tried to rename some documents using sql. Because of the way ID numbers are made, they disappear.  
09:16 <@cjdelisle> gmornin  
09:16 <kwoot> hm, not a good idea.  
09:16 <Pon> ahaha. dropping support for IE6  
09:17 <Pon> fortunately, no one pays for xwiki.  
09:17 <Pon> japanese companies would scream blue murder if that happened.  
09:17 <Pon> never mind that ie6 is a security nightmare, its their corpulent standard!  
09:18 <+sburjan> where, in japan ?  
09:18 <Pon> in lots of companies  
09:18 <Pon> softbank for example  
09:18 <@cjdelisle> lol soft-bank  
09:18 <+sburjan> I though japan was more high tech than this :)  
09:19 <Pon> youre out of your tree.  
09:19 <Pon> I'm sure I can think of something nice to say about softbank if they paid me to.  
09:19 <Pon> they have places still buying 15" screens.  
09:20 <Pon> they'd buy CRTs if they could!  
09:21 <@cjdelisle> dos?  
09:21 <Pon> windows xp ^^;  
09:21 <+sburjan> lol  
09:21 <+sburjan> in japan ? :)  
09:21 <+sburjan> I almmost can't belive it  
09:21 <Pon> It wouldnt surprise me if CJKI was still windows 98 though, that guy is a crackpot  
09:21 <Pon> y  
09:21 <Pon> <- 7 at home  
09:21 <@cjdelisle> How do ya like the latest sony drama?  
09:22 <jstoldt> meh, i think nabble hates me...  
09:23 <Pon> sony?  
09:23 <Pon> I wont buy their stuff again. not after 2 laptops expired mere days after their warranty.  
09:23 <Pon> the tv though, is 12 years old ^^;  
09:23 <kwoot> @cjdelisle: jast want to say thank you for pointing me in the right direction. With xwiki finally moving to production, I expect we will officially start bying commercial support (finally).  
09:24 <Pon> and going strong, if you dont mind the vga resolution.  
09:24 <jstoldt> mflorea: i tried to to reply to the WebODF discussion but nabble won't push my message through. so anyway, what i was going to say is that loosing support for MS Office documents should be avoided if possible because MS Office is still standard in a lot of companies which would rely on that  
09:24 <@cjdelisle> kwoot: cool  
09:24 <Pon> just store them as .doc ^^;  
09:24 <vmassol> guys ok to publish this blog post: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/BugFixingDayFebruary2011 ?  
09:25 <@cjdelisle> Sony is an enigma, the brilliance of their engineers is matched only by the idiocy of their management.  
09:25 <jstoldt> rely on the OOo service to import their office docs  
09:25 <Pon> winner! sergui! runner up, Vincent!  
09:26 <vmassol> yeah sergiu's a machine!  
09:26 <vmassol> :)  
09:26 <Pon> Oh, I lied,  
09:26 <Pon> I have a PS3 here, its a footrest  
09:26 <@cjdelisle> heh same  
09:27 <@cjdelisle> fool around with linux on it, never upgraded the firmware since it was new.  
09:27 <jstoldt> who needs an entertainment box if you got a compiler?  
09:27 <Pon> I dont know, but I find those adventure games difficult.  
09:27 <Pon> xyzzy  
09:28 <Pon> java SEVERE HORRIBLE ERROR OH GHOD WE'RE ALL GOING TO DIE at com.blah.plugh  
09:28 <Pon> at com.cheese.weasels.  
09:28 <Pon> at com.weasel.cheeser  
09:28 <Pon> at com.warmandgooey  
09:28 <Pon> at com.horrible error  
09:28 <Pon> ... and 89 more lines  
09:29 <kwoot> Pon: you're funny :-)  
09:29 <Pon> java errors never made any sense to me.  
09:29 <@cjdelisle> at com.sun.internal.dontlook.ThisClassDoesNotExist  
09:29 <vmassol> I've added 2 contributors I know who helped: Andreas and Johannes  
09:29 <vmassol> please add others if you know people who helped for the bugfixingday  
09:30 <+sburjan> sad that not all committers committed to bug fixing day  
09:30 <jstoldt> haha, thanks ;)  
09:30 <vmassol> sburjan: anyone can participate  
09:30 <+sburjan> i know  
09:30 <vmassol> by providing patches, triaging issues, etc  
09:30 <Pon> cjd - oo! I like thatone  
09:30 <vmassol> not just committers  
09:31 <+sburjan> i was helping yesterday too, written a test, but I didn't create a JIRA, so I won't make it to the list :)  
09:31 <vmassol> sburjan: why didn't you?  
09:32 <+sburjan> I concentrated all my energy in writing the test .. and i forgot to create JIRA  
09:32 <Pon> kyahaha  
09:33 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-5981 yay I fixed a real bug, except it took two days --> fail  
09:33 <Pon> cjd needs to spread the +o goodness incase he falls off.  
09:33 <Pon> omeme!  
09:34 <jstoldt> O\_O  
09:34 <@cjdelisle> freenode has this weird bot that's opped in every channel and gives +o to people.  
09:34 <+sburjan> :))  
09:34 <Pon> o.  
09:34 <Pon> my irc server just has  /opme  
09:34 <+sburjan> it's not a bot, it is considered a service :)  
09:35 <Pon> oh, nickserv?  
09:35 <+sburjan> and chanserv  
09:35 <jstoldt> chanserv  
09:35 <+sburjan> both are services  
09:35 <jstoldt> yeah... and don't try to reason with people who only care about being more superior than others  
09:35 <+sburjan> :D  
09:36 <@cjdelisle> My irssi installation has a script which does a 3 way handshake with random challange numbers and mitm resistance. It'll op anyone who's RSA key is in my directory and asks.  
09:36 <jstoldt> seriously, i got a project where people kept bugging me for adding their channel as the official localized channel whatever  
09:36 <jstoldt> and in the end i was like "know what, one channel for all languages and we're done"  
09:36 <@cjdelisle> but not needed on this net  
09:36 <+sburjan> vmassol: today I'm gonna create the JIRA and attach the patch, and I'll tag the issue as bugfixingday  
09:37 <Pon> all animals are created equal, but some animals are more equal than others.  
09:37 <jstoldt> one of the italian channels quit entirely and called me many things and the other two channels (one italian, one french) dragged me into long discussion about how many +, @ and & they would receive  
09:37 <jstoldt> freaking ridiculous  
09:38 <Pon> hey, if youre going to be the supreme ruler, you need the right attitude.  
09:38 <Pon> I decide, you suffer.  
09:38 <Pon> for example ^^;  
09:38 <jstoldt> which is what i usually do  
09:38 <cjdelisle> my only job is kicking spammers, I don't like the social drama  
09:38 <jstoldt> but for once somebody talked me into being nice with the kids  
09:38 <jstoldt> and that's what i got for it...  
09:39 <Pon> that will teach you to listen to people.  
09:39 <Pon> I mean, supreme dictators dont listen, they declare!  
09:39 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <Pon> then have their secret pole lice deal with any opposition  
09:39 <jstoldt> yep, which is a reasonable thing, i guess :-D  
09:40 <jstoldt> the translation wiki of xwiki.org is a place for numerous hours of translation fun. i can really recommend it to anyone!  
09:40 <Pon> reasonable would be something like "now, either die by your own hand, or by your own feet. I am feeling magnanimous today and will let you choose, but don't expect such a good mood to last."  
09:41 <cjdelisle> "jstoldt> the translation wiki of xwiki.org is a place for numerous hours of translation fun"  
09:41 <cjdelisle> lol we'd better double check js's translations.  
09:41 <Pon> see, he already has that evil genius' attitude!  
09:42 <Pon> are login ids case dependent?  
09:42 <cjdelisle> yes they are  
09:42 <Pon> gah  
09:42 <Pon> thats evil  
09:44 <Pon> that leaves room for impostors like  cjdeIisle which in many fonts would look the same as cjdelisle  
09:44 <Pon> the translation wiki is 2.0.4.x a bit behind ...  
09:46 <cjdelisle> what's more fun is choosing another name and then setting your first/last name the same since that's what displays.  
09:46 <Pon> I can see this will be a problem.  
09:47 <cjdelisle> Are you expecting security issues?  
09:47 <Pon> I'm firmly of the belief that if you don't design for security, you will spend a long time wishing you had.  
09:48 <Pon> for example,  
09:48 <Pon> vetting signups.  
09:48 <Pon> blacklisting signups from horrible places  
09:49 <Pon> requiring edits by proles to be approved by party workers  
09:49 <cjdelisle> he  
09:49 <cjdelisle> h  
09:49 <cjdelisle> You can make some of these thigns reality by modifying the document XWiki.Registration  
09:49 <jstoldt> lol, i think i did a good job translating everything!  
09:50 <jstoldt> but it was a pain to go through round 1800 translations at least twice  
09:50 <Pon> for example, the default is  view + register,  
09:50 <jstoldt> especially if you try to keep consistent wording in all places  
09:50 <+sburjan> vmassol: XE-833 .. tagged with bugfixingday dag :)  
09:50 <Pon> but once signed up, its a freeforall unless you nobble xwikiallgroup  
09:50 <cjdelisle> "hours of translating fun" --> cj thinks troll troll troll troll  
09:51 <Pon> http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/AddALanguage  
09:51 <jstoldt> translating the first major batch of translations took me three days or so, i think  
09:51 <jstoldt> i prefere IRL trolling  
09:51 <Pon> on there. that ApplicationResources thing is for what version?  
09:51 <Pon> I'd have to use unicode for everything.  
09:51 <jstoldt> tell people crap and wait for their reaction, try to figure out if they catch on to your sarcasm  
09:52 <Pon> that's mean.  
09:52 <cjdelisle> It's for the newest version but it should work with older versions.  
09:52 <Pon> 3.0M2 then?  
09:52 <cjdelisle> sure  
09:52 <jstoldt> Pon: if you work in the wiki, it will be done automatically, i understand... the conversion from unicode to ascii style, i mean  
09:53 <cjdelisle> They are very version independent, you could probably use the new one with xwiki-1.5 with no problem.  
09:53 <vmassol> sburjan: its not really a bug fix though  
09:53 <Pon> It says I need to download that file and translate it first.  
09:53 <cjdelisle> (nothing is ever removed :/ )  
09:53 <jstoldt> actually, i am judo trainer so i do use a lot of sarcasm on the kids i train, which is even more fun than translating fun!  
09:53 <+sburjan> no, it an improvement :)  
09:54 <+sburjan> I didn't do this to get listed on the blog ... did it to contribute :)  
09:54 <Pon> oh if youre that serious about your judo, you should already speak japanese ^^;  
09:54 <jstoldt> i did it for the lulz! :-P  
09:54 <jstoldt> i can only do a few words  
09:55 <jstoldt> but i think i am sounding very convinced when screaming things like "Matte" or "Yuko"  
09:55 <Pon> dont worry, it took a good few years to learn to read comics.  
09:55 <Pon> ????  
09:55 <Pon> yuko? thats a girl's name  
09:55 <Pon> ??  
09:55 <jstoldt> it's a small point in judo  
09:55 <Pon> do you mean "wait!" and "go!" ?  
09:56 <jstoldt> nope, Matte as in wait and yuko as in small point  
09:56 <jstoldt> hajime as in go  
09:56 <jstoldt> sore-made as in that's it  
09:56 <jstoldt> all the kind of stuff Judo referees use  
09:56 <Pon> hajime is a boy's name.  
09:56 <jstoldt> but very little more. although i can understand a few words  
09:56 <Pon> you probably mean "soko-made" as in "that's far enough"  
09:57 <Pon> and "hajimaru" "start" ^^;  
09:57 <jstoldt> nope, sore-made  
09:57 <Pon> wao, judo must be weird ^^;
